metadata.description: Cultural and medical semantics mapping for colloquial Hindi expressions in healthcare contexts.

entries.literal_translation: There is burning in the chest
entries.clinical_meaning: Often refers to heartburn/acidity (GERD/dyspepsia); must distinguish from cardiac chest pain.
entries.cultural_context: Commonly used for acid reflux after oily/spicy food; not necessarily cardiac.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द चलने/मेहनत करने पर बढ़ता है?
क्या दर्द बाएं हाथ या गर्दन तक जाता है?
खाना खाने के बाद या लेटने पर बढ़ता है?
डकार या एंटासिड से राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: रात को सीने में बहुत जलन होती है।
Meaning: Likely reflux at night; rule out cardiac red flags.
entries.translation_guidelines: Default to ‘heartburn’/‘acid reflux’ but explicitly rule out cardiac pain if red flags present.

entries.literal_translation: There is fire in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe acidity/epigastric burning; consider gastritis/ulcer if chronic or with alarm features.
entries.cultural_context: Hyperbolic phrase for intense burning due to acidity.
entries.temporal_hint: after spicy/oily meals; empty stomach ulcers worsen before meals/night
disambiguation_questions: क्या मल काला है या खून आ रहा है?
क्या दर्द खाली पेट अधिक होता है?
क्या दर्द एंटासिड से कम होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पिछले हफ्ते से पेट में आग सी लगी रहती है।
Meaning: Persistent burning; screen for ulcer/red flags.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘severe burning in the stomach (likely acidity)’; probe for ulcer warning signs.

entries.expression_native: मेरे वो दिन चल रहे हैं
entries.expression_translit: mere woh din chal rahe hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Menstruation/period is ongoing.
entries.cultural_context: Euphemism to refer to menstruation politely.
disambiguation_questions: खून का बहाव सामान्य से अधिक है?
example_use_cases: Patient: मेरे वो दिन चल रहे हैं और पेट में बहुत दर्द है।
Meaning: On period with cramps; consider dysmenorrhea management.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate to ‘I’m on my period’; add clinical qualifiers only if stated.

entries.expression_native: उन दिनों में नेगेटिव विचार ज़्यादा आते हैं
entries.expression_translit: unn dino mein negative vichaar zyada aate hain
entries.literal_translation: During those days, negative thoughts come more
entries.clinical_meaning: Mood changes around menstruation; consider PMS/PMDD if functional impairment.
entries.cultural_context: Associates mood swings with menstrual phase; stigma may reduce explicit disclosure.
entries.temporal_hint: luteal phase; improves after menses onset
disambiguation_questions: क्या ये लक्षण हर चक्र में होते हैं?
कभी स्वयं को चोट पहुँचाने का विचार?
example_use_cases: Patient: उन दिनों में बहुत चिड़चिड़ापन और उदासी रहती है।
Meaning: Screen for PMS/PMDD; assess severity and safety.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate empathetically; avoid pathologizing unless impairment/safety concerns.

entries.clinical_meaning: Dysuria suggesting UTI; consider STI, vaginitis, prostatitis based on context.
entries.cultural_context: Often attributed to ‘heat’ (गर्मी) or dehydration.
disambiguation_questions: क्या बुखार या कमर के तरफ दर्द है?
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से पेशाब में तेज़ जलन है।
Meaning: Acute dysuria; evaluate for UTI and red flags.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘burning while urinating’; include neutral tone; probe safety.

entries.clinical_meaning: May refer to fever, heat exhaustion, or general malaise from hot weather/spicy food.
entries.cultural_context: ‘Heat’ is a common explanatory model; not specific clinically.
example_use_cases: Patient: कल से गarmi चढ़ी हुई लग रही है।
Meaning: Check temperature and hydration; rule out infection/heat illness.
entries.translation_guidelines: Avoid literal ‘heat rose’; prefer ‘feeling feverish/overheated’ and clarify.

entries.clinical_meaning: Sadness/low mood; sometimes chest heaviness metaphor—assess for depression vs cardiac if physical symptoms.
entries.cultural_context: Metaphor for grief/sadness; may be mistaken as physical pain.
disambiguation_questions: ये भावनात्मक उदासी है या शारीरिक दर्द?
कभी स्वयं को चोट पहुँचाने का विचार?
example_use_cases: Patient: कई दिनों से दिल भारी लगता है।
Meaning: Likely low mood; screen safety and somatic red flags.
entries.translation_guidelines: Default to emotional meaning unless physical red flags; be empathetic.

entries.clinical_meaning: Shortness of breath; consider asthma, COPD, anemia, heart failure, anxiety, deconditioning.
entries.cultural_context: Common phrase for dyspnea on exertion or anxiety.
disambiguation_questions: कितनी दूरी पर सांस फूलती है?
सीने में दर्द के साथ है?
example_use_cases: Patient: थोड़ा चलने पर भी सांस फूल जाती है।
Meaning: Dyspnea on exertion; risk stratify.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘shortness of breath’; clarify exertion vs rest and red flags.

entries.clinical_meaning: Non-specific dizziness; can mean vertigo, lightheadedness, presyncope.
entries.cultural_context: Used broadly; needs precise characterization.
disambiguation_questions: क्या कमज़ोरी/बेहोशी जैसा लगता है या कमरे के घूमने जैसा?
example_use_cases: Patient: अचानक चक्कर आ गया और बैठना पड़ा।
Meaning: Clarify vertigo vs presyncope; check vitals.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘dizzy/lightheaded’; add clarifiers via follow-ups.

entries.clinical_meaning: Generalized fatigue/weakness; could be anemia, hypothyroid, infection, depression.
entries.cultural_context: Common catch-all for tiredness; often nutritional.
disambiguation_questions: खून की कमी/थायरॉइड की जाँच हुई?
example_use_cases: Patient: कुछ भी करने का दम नहीं है, कमज़ोरी रहती है।
Meaning: Screen anemia, thyroid, mood, sleep.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘general weakness/fatigue’; avoid implying muscle-power loss unless stated.

entries.literal_translation: There is a lack of blood
entries.clinical_meaning: Anemia (self-reported or suspected).
entries.cultural_context: Lay term for anemia; often nutritional (iron/B12).
disambiguation_questions: हाल की जाँच में Hb कितना था?
महिलाओं में मासिक धर्म का बहाव ज्यादा?
example_use_cases: Patient: मुझे खून की कमी बताई थी।
Meaning: Confirm labs; assess causes.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘anemia/low hemoglobin’ if documented; otherwise ‘suspected anemia’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Diabetes mellitus (self-reported).
entries.cultural_context: ‘Sugar’ commonly used for diabetes.
disambiguation_questions: सुगर कंट्रोल के लिए कौनसी दवा?
example_use_cases: Patient: मुझे शुगर है, दवा लेता/लेती हूँ।
Meaning: Confirm control and complications.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘I have diabetes’; avoid minimizing seriousness.

entries.clinical_meaning: Hypertension or transient high blood pressure.
entries.cultural_context: Self-reported from kiosk/home devices; may be situational.
example_use_cases: Patient: कल BP बढ़ा था, सिर दर्द भी था।
Meaning: Evaluate urgency vs routine management.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘high blood pressure’; request numeric values if available.

entries.clinical_meaning: Hoarseness/laryngitis; usually viral/overuse; consider GERD/allergy if chronic.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom for hoarse voice.
example_use_cases: Patient: कल से गला बैठ गया है, आवाज़ नहीं निकल रही।
Meaning: Likely laryngitis; rest/hydration; check red flags if chronic.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘my voice is hoarse’; avoid literal translation.

entries.clinical_meaning: Arthralgia; consider OA, RA, viral arthritis, vitamin D deficiency.
entries.cultural_context: Often attributed to ‘गठिया’ broadly.
disambiguation_questions: सुबह जकड़न कितनी देर रहती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: घुटनों और कंधों में दर्द रहता है।
Meaning: Characterize pattern; screen inflammatory signs.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘joint pains’; add qualifiers from history.

entries.clinical_meaning: Bloating/belching/flatulence/epigastric discomfort; common lay label for upper GI symptoms.
entries.cultural_context: Used broadly for abdominal discomfort.
disambiguation_questions: फुलाव, डकार या जलन में से क्या प्रमुख है?
example_use_cases: Patient: थोड़ी सी भी गैस हो जाए तो नींद नहीं आती।
Meaning: Clarify dominant symptom and severity.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘gas/bloating’ depending on description; avoid over-interpretation.

entries.clinical_meaning: Nausea; check pregnancy possibility, gastritis, infection, migraine.
entries.cultural_context: Often linked to ‘gas’ or ‘heat’.
example_use_cases: Patient: सुबह से उल्टी जैसा लग रहा है।
Meaning: Nausea; assess cause and hydration.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘nauseous/feel like vomiting’; probe pregnancy and hydration.

entries.clinical_meaning: Palpitations; may be anxiety, arrhythmia, hyperthyroid, anemia, caffeine.
entries.cultural_context: Used for awareness of heartbeat especially during stress.
example_use_cases: Patient: बात-बात पर दिल धड़कने लगता है।
Meaning: Characterize triggers; rule out red flags.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘palpitations’; clarify frequency/duration.

entries.clinical_meaning: Recurrent early pregnancy loss or difficulty maintaining pregnancy.
entries.cultural_context: Sensitive topic; may imply prior miscarriages.
example_use_cases: Patient: दो बार गर्भ ठहर नहीं पाया।
Meaning: Needs compassionate evaluation and referral.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use sensitive wording: ‘difficulty carrying a pregnancy’; avoid blame.

entries.clinical_meaning: Insomnia; could be stress, anxiety, depression, or lifestyle related.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom expressing sleeplessness due to worry or stress.
disambiguation_questions: कब से नींद नहीं आ रही?
सोने की कोशिश में क्या सोचते रहते हैं?
दवाइयाँ या मोबाइल का उपयोग रात में?
example_use_cases: Patient: पिछले हफ्ते से नींद नहीं आती।
Meaning: Possible insomnia; explore stressors and habits.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘can’t sleep’ or ‘insomnia’; probe emotional and medical factors.

entries.expression_native: मुँह में छाले हो गए हैं
entries.expression_translit: munh mein chhale ho gaye hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Aphthous ulcers or nutritional deficiency; can relate to stress or acidity.
entries.cultural_context: Often attributed to ‘body heat’ (गर्मी) or spicy food.
disambiguation_questions: क्या खाना खाते समय जलन होती है?
कौनसा टूथपेस्ट या दवा उपयोग कर रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: मुँह में दर्द और छाले हो गए हैं।
Meaning: Check for aphthous ulcers or vitamin B12 deficiency.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘mouth ulcers’; avoid literal translation.

entries.clinical_meaning: Could indicate sinusitis, migraine, stress, or hypertension.
entries.cultural_context: Used broadly for dull headache or stress.
disambiguation_questions: क्या नाक बंद है या जुकाम?
दर्द सिर के किस हिस्से में है?
example_use_cases: Patient: सर भारी लग रहा है और कुछ करने का मन नहीं।
Meaning: Tension-type headache; check BP, hydration, and stress.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘head feels heavy’; clarify cause by context.

entries.literal_translation: Pain moves around in the head
entries.clinical_meaning: Migrainous or tension-type headache; sometimes sinus-related.
entries.cultural_context: Used to describe radiating or shifting headache pain.
disambiguation_questions: दर्द किस हिस्से में ज़्यादा होता है?
क्या उल्टी या रोशनी से परेशानी?
example_use_cases: Patient: सिर में घूम-घूमकर दर्द होता है।
Meaning: Evaluate for migraine pattern and triggers.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘rotating or shifting headache’; add clarifiers.

entries.clinical_meaning: Abdominal distension due to gas, IBS, constipation, or ascites.
entries.cultural_context: Lay term for bloating; often attributed to ‘gas’.
disambiguation_questions: खाना खाने के बाद बढ़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: थोड़ा सा भी खा लूँ तो पेट फूल जाता है।
Meaning: Possible bloating or dyspepsia.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bloating’; avoid literal ‘stomach swelled’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Frozen shoulder or adhesive capsulitis; often diabetic or post-injury.
entries.cultural_context: Colloquial for restricted movement of shoulder.
example_use_cases: Patient: छह महीने से कंधा जाम है।
Meaning: Likely frozen shoulder; assess mobility and diabetic history.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘shoulder stiffness’ or ‘frozen shoulder’.

entries.literal_translation: There is a roughness in the throat
entries.clinical_meaning: Pharyngitis or throat irritation; viral, allergic, or reflux cause.
entries.cultural_context: Common seasonal complaint; often mild.
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से गले में खराश है।
Meaning: Mild pharyngitis; supportive care advised.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘throat irritation’ or ‘sore throat’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Asthma, bronchitis, or allergy-related wheeze.
entries.cultural_context: Used for noisy breathing during exertion or cold.
example_use_cases: Patient: ठंडी हवा में सांस घरघराने लगती है।
Meaning: Asthmatic tendency; evaluate inhaler need.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘wheezing’ or ‘breath sounds’ appropriately.

entries.clinical_meaning: Sudden sadness, panic, or emotional shock; could also describe faintness.
entries.cultural_context: Metaphor for emotional overwhelm or presyncope.
example_use_cases: Patient: किसी बुरी खबर पर दिल बैठ गया।
Meaning: Emotional shock; distinguish from physical syncope.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate contextually — emotional vs physical.

entries.literal_translation: Hands and feet have gone numb
entries.clinical_meaning: Paresthesia due to neuropathy, anxiety, or vascular issues.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom for tingling or numbness.
example_use_cases: Patient: ठंड में हाथ-पैर सुन्न हो जाते हैं।
Meaning: Possible neuropathy or vascular spasm.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘numbness or tingling’; clarify distribution.

entries.clinical_meaning: Loss of appetite; may indicate infection, depression, hypothyroidism, or gastritis.
entries.cultural_context: Common phrase to describe poor appetite or malaise.
disambiguation_questions: खाना देखकर घिन या मन नहीं करता?
example_use_cases: Patient: दो हफ्तों से भूख नहीं लगती।
Meaning: Could be loss of appetite due to infection or depression.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘loss of appetite’; avoid literal phrasing.

entries.clinical_meaning: Could indicate anxiety, hypoglycemia, fever, or cardiac distress.
entries.cultural_context: Used when sweating excessively during tension or weakness.
disambiguation_questions: पसीना कब आता है — मेहनत में या आराम में?
क्या चक्कर या कमजोरी भी होती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बात-बात पर पसीना छूट जाता है।
Meaning: Could be anxiety or hypoglycemia; evaluate cause.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘sweating excessively’; explore stress or metabolic causes.

entries.expression_native: आँखों के आगे अंधेरा छा जाता है
entries.expression_translit: aankhon ke aage andhera chha jaata hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Syncope, dizziness, or hypotension; can also mean emotional shock.
entries.cultural_context: Describes momentary blackout or faintness.
disambiguation_questions: कितनी देर के लिए अंधेरा आता है?
क्या दिल की धड़कन तेज़ हो जाती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अचानक आंखों के आगे अंधेरा छा गया।
Meaning: Possible syncope; rule out cardiac or hypotensive cause.
entries.translation_guidelines: Use ‘blacked out’ or ‘fainted’; confirm safety.

entries.clinical_meaning: Tinnitus; may be due to infection, hearing loss, or medication side effect.
entries.cultural_context: Used to describe humming or buzzing in ears.
disambiguation_questions: कोई दवा शुरू की थी हाल में?
example_use_cases: Patient: कुछ दिन से कान बज रहे हैं।
Meaning: Likely tinnitus; check ear and systemic causes.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘ringing in the ears’.

entries.literal_translation: There is twisting in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Abdominal cramps; possible infection, dysmenorrhea, or IBS.
entries.cultural_context: Describes cramp-like abdominal pain; common lay expression.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पीरियड्स के दौरान होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: आज सुबह से पेट में मरोड़ हो रहा है।
Meaning: Likely cramps; check for GI or menstrual link.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘abdominal cramps’ appropriately.

entries.clinical_meaning: Myalgia from viral infection, exertion, or fatigue.
entries.cultural_context: Used broadly for muscle aches with fever or fatigue.
example_use_cases: Patient: पूरे बदन में दर्द हो रहा है।
Meaning: Myalgia; check for viral fever or dehydration.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘body ache’ or ‘myalgia’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Sleep apnea, asthma, panic attack, or heart failure.
entries.cultural_context: Used when waking up gasping or feeling suffocated.
disambiguation_questions: क्या ये नींद में होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: रात में सांस रुक-सी जाती है।
Meaning: Evaluate for sleep apnea or cardiac causes.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘breath stops momentarily’; clarify timing.

entries.literal_translation: There is restlessness in the heart
entries.clinical_meaning: Anxiety, palpitations, or panic episodes; sometimes cardiac ischemia in elders.
entries.cultural_context: Widely used to describe uneasiness or panic sensations.
disambiguation_questions: क्या घबराहट किसी खास समय या जगह पर होती है?
क्या आराम करने से ठीक होती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अचानक दिल में घबराहट होती है।
Meaning: Likely panic or anxiety; rule out cardiac cause.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling of anxiety/restlessness in chest’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Dysgeusia or nausea; may be due to fever, liver issues, or gastritis.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom for malaise or poor appetite.
disambiguation_questions: कब से मुँह कड़वा लग रहा है?
पेशाब या आँखों का रंग बदला?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार के बाद से मुँह कड़वा लग रहा है।
Meaning: Could suggest hepatic or post-infectious dysgeusia.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bitter taste in mouth’; note systemic illness if any.

entries.literal_translation: There is tingling in the leg
entries.clinical_meaning: Peripheral neuropathy, vitamin deficiency, or anxiety.
entries.cultural_context: Frequent complaint among diabetics or B12 deficiency.
example_use_cases: Patient: रात को पैरों में झनझनाहट रहती है।
Meaning: Possible neuropathy; check B12 and sugar levels.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘tingling sensation in feet’.

entries.literal_translation: The back feels like it’s breaking
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe backache or fatigue; could relate to musculoskeletal strain, menstruation, or viral fever.
entries.cultural_context: Used for body ache from overwork, fever, or menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पीरियड्स या बुखार के साथ है?
लेटने पर या उठने पर बढ़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से कमर टूट रही है।
Meaning: Likely fatigue-related; evaluate for strain or viral fever.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘severe backache’ or ‘body ache’; avoid literal phrasing.

entries.clinical_meaning: May refer to anticoagulant use or perceived weakness; not a medical diagnosis unless medication-related.
entries.cultural_context: Common misbelief; often used when bruising or bleeding occurs easily.
disambiguation_questions: क्या डॉक्टर ने कोई ब्लड पतला करने की दवा दी?
कोई दवा जैसे Ecosprin ले रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: डॉक्टर ने कहा खून पतला है, दवा बंद कर दी।
Meaning: Verify if on anticoagulants or misunderstanding.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate carefully; verify if they mean ‘on blood thinner medication’.

entries.literal_translation: There is swelling in the legs
entries.clinical_meaning: Pedal edema due to cardiac, renal, hepatic, or nutritional cause.
entries.cultural_context: Used both medically and non-medically; may relate to prolonged standing.
example_use_cases: Patient: शाम होते-होते पैरों में सूजन आ जाती है।
Meaning: Possible cardiac or renal cause; check vitals and labs.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘leg swelling’; specify possible systemic causes.

entries.expression_native: दिल बैठ जाता है डर के मारे
entries.expression_translit: dil baith jaata hai dar ke maare
entries.clinical_meaning: Acute anxiety or panic triggered by fear stimulus.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom for fear-induced physical sensations.
disambiguation_questions: दिल की धड़कन तेज़ हो जाती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: डर लगने पर दिल बैठ जाता है।
Meaning: Acute anxiety response; screen for panic disorder.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘panic or fear sensation’; be empathetic.

entries.clinical_meaning: Urinary frequency; consider UTI, diabetes, or prostate issues.
entries.cultural_context: Lay complaint often linked to ‘sugar’ or cold exposure.
disambiguation_questions: रात में कितनी बार उठते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: दिन-रात पेशाब बार-बार आता है।
Meaning: Polyuria; check for diabetes or UTI.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘frequent urination’; clarify cause.

entries.literal_translation: There is heaviness in the chest
entries.clinical_meaning: Could mean cardiac discomfort, anxiety, or respiratory congestion.
entries.cultural_context: Ambiguous term requiring detailed probing.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द मेहनत पर बढ़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: सीने में भारीपन महसूस होता है।
Meaning: Could be cardiac or anxiety; check ECG and vitals.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘chest heaviness’; rule out red flags.

entries.clinical_meaning: Constipation or incomplete evacuation; common digestive concern.
entries.cultural_context: Common Indian idiom for irregular bowel movements.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन में टॉयलेट जाते हैं?
खाना और पानी कैसा लेते हैं?

Meaning: Likely constipation; advise diet and hydration changes.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘constipation’ or ‘not passing stool fully’.

entries.expression_native: गर्मी बढ़ गई है शरीर में
entries.expression_translit: garmi badh gayi hai shareer mein
entries.literal_translation: Heat has increased in the body
entries.clinical_meaning: Lay explanation for fever, acne, ulcers, or restlessness.
entries.cultural_context: Ayurvedic notion of body ‘heat’ imbalance.
disambiguation_questions: धूप या गर्म चीज़ों से बढ़ता है?

Meaning: Possible mild fever or dehydration.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate contextually — ‘feverish’ or ‘overheated’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Vertigo or dizziness; due to inner ear or low BP.
entries.cultural_context: Used interchangeably with ‘chakkar aana’.
disambiguation_questions: कब होता है — उठने पर या लगातार?
example_use_cases: Patient: सुबह से सिर घूम रहा है।
Meaning: Possible vertigo or low blood pressure.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling dizzy/spinning sensation’.

entries.literal_translation: There is burning in the eyes
entries.clinical_meaning: Eye irritation from dryness, infection, or allergy.
entries.cultural_context: Frequent idiom for irritation due to pollution or heat.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पानी या मवाद निकलता है?
क्या रोशनी से परेशानी होती है?
स्क्रीन पर कितनी देर रहते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: धूल से आँखों में जलन हो रही है।
Meaning: Likely allergic or irritant conjunctivitis.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘burning eyes’; note environmental cause.

entries.expression_native: पेट में गैस चढ़ जाती है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein gas chadh jaati hai
entries.literal_translation: Gas rises up in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Bloating or reflux; often misattributed cause for chest discomfort.
entries.cultural_context: Common explanatory phrase in India for acidity-related symptoms.

Meaning: Could be reflux; rule out cardiac red flags.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘gas rising up/acidity’; clarify if reflux or cardiac.

entries.clinical_meaning: Dry mouth; dehydration, anxiety, or medication side effect.
entries.cultural_context: Used to describe thirst or nervous dryness of mouth.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पानी ज़्यादा पी रहे हैं?
गर्मी या डर के वक्त बढ़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: डर लगने पर गला सूख जाता है।
Meaning: Anxiety-related dry mouth; check hydration and glucose.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘dry throat/mouth’; clarify anxiety vs dehydration.

entries.clinical_meaning: Halitosis; could stem from poor oral hygiene, gastritis, or sinus issues.
entries.cultural_context: Socially sensitive complaint in India, often linked to ‘pet saaf nahi hona’.
disambiguation_questions: मुँह धोने के बाद भी बदबू रहती है?
कोई दाँत या मसूड़े में दर्द?
example_use_cases: Patient: सुबह उठते ही मुँह से बदबू आती है।
Meaning: Possibly halitosis; check oral hygiene and gastric reflux.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bad breath’; maintain sensitivity.

entries.clinical_meaning: Possible hyperglycemia symptom or altered taste sensation.
entries.cultural_context: Some diabetics describe sweet taste or sticky saliva.
disambiguation_questions: क्या शुगर की दवा चल रही है?
example_use_cases: Patient: मुँह में मिठास लगती है, शुगर बढ़ी होगी।
Meaning: Possible sign of hyperglycemia.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘sweet taste in mouth’; assess glucose control.

entries.clinical_meaning: Fever or localized headache; common indicator of illness.
entries.cultural_context: Lay method of identifying fever by touch.
disambiguation_questions: कब से गर्मी लग रही है?
example_use_cases: Patient: माथा गर्म लग रहा है और ठंड लग रही।
Meaning: Likely fever onset.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feverish feeling’; confirm with measurement.

entries.clinical_meaning: Nasal congestion; could be due to cold, allergy, or sinusitis.
entries.cultural_context: Extremely common Indian idiom during cold weather.
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से नाक बंद है, सांस लेने में मुश्किल है।
Meaning: Nasal congestion; likely viral or allergic rhinitis.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘blocked nose’; avoid literal phrasing.

entries.clinical_meaning: Productive cough; bronchitis or infection.
entries.cultural_context: Used for mucus-producing cough, common in Indian winter.
example_use_cases: Patient: सुबह-सुबह बलगम निकलता है।
Meaning: Likely bronchitis or postnasal drip.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘phlegm or sputum production’.

entries.literal_translation: There are worms in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Worm infestation; common belief for unexplained abdominal pain in children.
entries.cultural_context: Common lay belief especially among rural populations.
disambiguation_questions: क्या बच्चा पेट दर्द की शिकायत करता है?
पिछली बार कीड़ा मार दवा कब ली?
example_use_cases: Patient: बच्चे को पेट में कीड़े हैं, दवा चाहिए।
Meaning: Deworming indicated if clinically consistent.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘intestinal worms’; clarify duration and hygiene factors.

entries.clinical_meaning: Severe headache or migraine; expression of extreme pain.
entries.cultural_context: Used hyperbolically to convey intense headache or stress.
synonyms_variants: सर दर्द से पागल हो गया
disambiguation_questions: रोशनी या आवाज़ से बढ़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: आज सिर फट रहा है, कुछ काम नहीं हो रहा।
Meaning: Severe headache; possible migraine.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘severe headache’; consider migraine or stress cause.

entries.clinical_meaning: Loss of motivation or enjoyment; anhedonia or burnout.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom indicating emotional fatigue or mild depression.
disambiguation_questions: क्या किसी चीज़ में आनंद आता है?
कब से ऐसा महसूस हो रहा है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब किसी चीज़ में दिल नहीं लगता, उचाट हो गया हूँ।
Meaning: Screen for depression or emotional burnout.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘loss of interest’ empathetically.

entries.clinical_meaning: Currently menstruating; euphemism for menstrual period.
entries.cultural_context: Common modest way of saying ‘on period’ in India, often to avoid direct mention.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन से चल रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: आज थोड़ी कमजोरी है, वो दिन चल रहे हैं।
Meaning: Patient is on her menstrual cycle.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘currently menstruating’; maintain sensitivity.

entries.expression_native: पेट में बहुत दर्द है उन दिनों
entries.expression_translit: pet mein bahut dard hai un dino
entries.literal_translation: There is much pain in the stomach during those days
entries.clinical_meaning: Dysmenorrhea; menstrual cramps.
entries.cultural_context: Widely used expression for period cramps or lower abdominal pain.
disambiguation_questions: कभी बेहोशी या उल्टी होती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर बार उन दिनों में पेट में बहुत दर्द होता है।
Meaning: Likely menstrual cramps; evaluate for dysmenorrhea.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘menstrual cramps’; avoid literal stomach reference.

entries.clinical_meaning: Menstrual fatigue or mild anemia.
entries.cultural_context: Common self-reported symptom during menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने कमजोरी लगती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर बार पीरियड्स में बहुत कमजोरी लगती है।
Meaning: Could suggest anemia or menstrual fatigue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling weak during periods’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Menstrual irregularity; may indicate PCOS, thyroid, or stress-related causes.
entries.cultural_context: Direct but common expression; usually self-reported by urban patients.
synonyms_variants: मासिक धर्म समय पर नहीं आता
example_use_cases: Patient: पिछले कुछ महीनों से पीरियड्स बहुत अनियमित हैं।
Meaning: Possible PCOS or endocrine cause.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘irregular menstrual cycle’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Menorrhagia; excessive menstrual flow.
entries.cultural_context: Common concern; may cause anemia or fatigue.
synonyms_variants: लंबे दिन तक पीरियड्स रहते हैं
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन तक ब्लीडिंग रहती है?
कपड़े या पैड कितनी बार बदलती हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर महीने बहुत ज़्यादा ब्लीडिंग होती है।
Meaning: Suggests heavy flow; evaluate for menorrhagia.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘heavy menstrual bleeding’; document duration and severity.

entries.expression_native: पीरियड्स के पहले चिड़चिड़ापन रहता है
entries.expression_translit: periods ke pehle chidchidapan rehta hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) – mood changes, irritability.
entries.cultural_context: Relates to emotional fluctuations before menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा होता है?
कितने दिन पहले शुरू होता है?
क्या नींद या भूख पर असर पड़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स के पहले बहुत चिड़चिड़ापन रहता है।
Meaning: Typical PMS; observe pattern and triggers.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘irritability before periods’; validate emotional symptom.

entries.expression_native: पीरियड्स में पेट फूल जाता है
entries.expression_translit: periods mein pet phool jaata hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Menstrual bloating; water retention or hormonal swelling.
entries.cultural_context: Common premenstrual symptom described in daily talk.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा होता है?
कितने दिन में कम हो जाता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स में पेट फूल जाता है।
Meaning: Premenstrual bloating or mild water retention.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bloating during periods’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Hypotension or anemia during menstruation.
entries.cultural_context: Expresses low BP or iron deficiency symptoms linked to menstruation.

Meaning: May indicate anemia; test Hb level.

entries.clinical_meaning: Insomnia due to cramps, discomfort, or mood fluctuations.
entries.cultural_context: Common symptom reflecting hormonal and physical discomfort.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द से नींद नहीं आती?
क्या हर महीने ऐसा होता है?
कोई दवा या चाय-कॉफी रात में?

Meaning: Menstrual discomfort causing insomnia.

entries.expression_native: उन दिनों मूड बदल जाता है
entries.expression_translit: un dino mood badal jaata hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Mood swings during menstruation or PMS.
entries.cultural_context: Casual acknowledgment of hormonal mood variation during menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या मूड हर बार बदलता है?

example_use_cases: Patient: उन दिनों मूड बहुत जल्दी बदल जाता है।
Meaning: PMS-related mood swings.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘mood changes during menstruation’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Pelvic heaviness during menstruation; may indicate cramps or PMS.
entries.cultural_context: Polite phrasing for menstrual discomfort in lower abdomen.
disambiguation_questions: क्या ये दर्द हर महीने होता है?
क्या बुखार या सफेद डिस्चार्ज है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स के समय नीचे भारीपन लगता है।
Meaning: Common menstrual symptom; observe for pattern.

entries.literal_translation: There is a pulling sensation below
entries.clinical_meaning: Pelvic discomfort or mild cramping before/during periods.
entries.cultural_context: Common idiom indicating internal tension before menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन पहले दर्द शुरू होता है?
क्या पीरियड्स के बाद ठीक हो जाता है?

Meaning: Premenstrual tension or mild uterine cramps.

entries.clinical_meaning: Passage of clots during menstruation; may indicate heavy flow.
entries.cultural_context: Frequent concern shared by women describing heavy periods.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने थक्के आते हैं?
क्या दर्द के साथ आते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर महीने खून के थक्के निकलते हैं।
Meaning: Indicates menorrhagia; assess bleeding severity.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘blood clots during periods’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Lower abdominal cramping during periods.
entries.cultural_context: Vivid description of uterine cramps.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा दर्द होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स में पेट नीचे खिंचता है।
Meaning: Menstrual cramps due to uterine contraction.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘lower abdominal pulling pain’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Extreme body ache or fatigue during menstruation.
entries.cultural_context: Expresses fatigue, pain, and body weakness during menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर बार ऐसा महसूस होता है?

Meaning: Menstrual fatigue; ensure rest and hydration.

entries.clinical_meaning: Delayed period; possible hormonal imbalance or stress.
entries.cultural_context: Polite euphemism for menstrual delay, used commonly in social settings.

Meaning: Menstrual delay likely due to stress or hormonal imbalance.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘periods came late’; clarify cause gently.

entries.expression_native: वो दिन समय पर नहीं आते

entries.cultural_context: Another indirect euphemism for delayed or irregular periods.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिनों से गड़बड़ चल रही है?

पीसीओएस या थायरॉइड की जांच हुई?

Meaning: Menstrual irregularity needing evaluation.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘irregular periods’.

entries.expression_native: वो दिन बहुत जल्दी आ जाते हैं
entries.expression_translit: wo din bahut jaldi aa jaate hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Short menstrual cycle; possible hormonal imbalance or stress response.
entries.cultural_context: Used to describe frequent menstruation or shortened cycle.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन में दोबारा आ जाते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो हर तीन हफ्ते में वो दिन आ जाते हैं।
Meaning: Polymenorrhea; may need cycle regulation.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘frequent periods’; clarify pattern and duration.

entries.literal_translation: Those days are about to come
entries.clinical_meaning: Premenstrual phase with emotional and physical symptoms.
entries.cultural_context: Indirectly indicates upcoming menstruation; often linked with mood or cramps.
synonyms_variants: मूड खराब है उन दिनों से पहले
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा महसूस होता है?
कितने दिन पहले लक्षण शुरू होते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: लग रहा है वो दिन आने वाले हैं, मूड भी खराब है।
Meaning: Premenstrual signs; common and normal.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘about to get periods’.

entries.expression_native: वो दिन बहुत दर्दनाक होते हैं
entries.expression_translit: wo din bahut dardnaak hote hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe dysmenorrhea; possibly endometriosis or uterine pathology.
entries.cultural_context: Common expression reflecting extreme period pain and discomfort.

disambiguation_questions: कितने साल से ऐसा दर्द है?
क्या दवा से राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: वो दिन बहुत दर्दनाक होते हैं, काम पर नहीं जा पाती।
Meaning: Severe dysmenorrhea or possible endometriosis.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘severe period pain’; maintain empathy and note chronicity.

entries.expression_native: वो दिन बहुत हल्के रहते हैं
entries.expression_translit: wo din bahut halke rehte hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Scanty menstrual flow (hypomenorrhea).
entries.cultural_context: Used to describe very little bleeding, often linked to stress or hormonal change.

Meaning: Scanty flow; likely hormonal or stress-related.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘light periods’; avoid implying infertility unless asked.

entries.expression_native: वो दिन रुक-रुक कर आते हैं
entries.expression_translit: wo din ruk-ruk kar aate hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Interrupted or spotting-type menstrual flow.
entries.cultural_context: Common phrase for irregular bleeding or mid-cycle spotting.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा होता है?

Meaning: Suggests irregular or incomplete flow.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘irregular/spotty periods’.

entries.expression_native: नीचे जलन होती है पीरियड्स में

entries.clinical_meaning: Vulvar irritation or infection during menstruation.
entries.cultural_context: Often due to poor hygiene or allergic reaction to pads.

disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा होता है?
क्या किसी खास पैड से बढ़ता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स में नीचे जलन होती है।
Meaning: Likely local irritation or infection.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘burning or irritation during periods’; advise hygiene discussion.

entries.clinical_meaning: Foul menstrual odor possibly due to infection or poor hygiene.
entries.cultural_context: Sensitive concern, often avoided in direct conversation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या ये हर बार होता है?
क्या डिस्चार्ज या खुजली भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: उन दिनों गंध आती है और जलन भी होती है।
Meaning: Suggests infection or hygiene issue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘foul smell during periods’; use sensitive tone.

entries.clinical_meaning: Severe lower back pain associated with menstruation.
entries.cultural_context: Very common phrase expressing backache and fatigue.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द नीचे तक जाता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर बार पीरियड्स में कमर टूटती है।
Meaning: Common menstrual back pain; rule out endometriosis if severe.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘severe back pain during periods’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Pelvic pressure or heaviness during menstruation.
entries.cultural_context: Polite phrasing describing discomfort during flow days.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा दबाव लगता है?
क्या दर्द या जलन भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स में नीचे दबाव महसूस होता है।
Meaning: Pelvic pressure common during menstruation.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘pelvic pressure sensation’.

entries.expression_native: पीरियड्स में मन खराब रहता है
entries.expression_translit: periods mein man kharab rehta hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Low mood or irritability during menstruation (PMS).
entries.cultural_context: Common euphemism for mood swings during menstruation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर महीने ऐसा महसूस होता है?
क्या काम पर असर पड़ता है?
क्या पीरियड्स के बाद मूड ठीक हो जाता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पीरियड्स में मन खराब रहता है, किसी से बात नहीं करनी।
Meaning: PMS-related mood disturbance.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘low mood during periods’; be empathetic.

entries.clinical_meaning: Vulvar or pelvic swelling during menstruation; may be due to inflammation or fluid retention.
entries.cultural_context: Sensitive topic, described euphemistically.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द या जलन भी है?
क्या हर महीने ऐसा होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: उन दिनों नीचे सूजन आ जाती है।
Meaning: Common fluid retention or irritation; rule out infection.
