example_use_cases: Patient: हाथ ऊपर उठाने में दर्द होता है।
Meaning: Typical of rotator cuff injury or frozen shoulder.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘shoulder pain on raising arm’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Leg fatigue, venous insufficiency, or joint stiffness.
entries.cultural_context: Very common Indian phrasing for lower-limb fatigue.
disambiguation_questions: क्या आराम करने से ठीक होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: शाम तक पैरों में भारीपन होने लगता है।
Meaning: Common sign of leg fatigue or venous congestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘heaviness or fatigue in legs’.

entries.expression_native: रीढ़ में दर्द हो रहा है
entries.expression_translit: reedh mein dard ho raha hai
entries.literal_translation: Pain is happening in the spine
entries.clinical_meaning: Backache due to spinal or muscular cause.
entries.cultural_context: Used broadly; can indicate stress-related or posture-related pain.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द नीचे तक जाता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: रीढ़ में दर्द हो रहा है, बैठना मुश्किल है।
Meaning: Chronic or posture-related back pain.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘spinal/back pain’.

entries.expression_native: उम्र हो गई है, शरीर साथ नहीं देता
entries.expression_translit: umr ho gayi hai, sharir saath nahi deta
entries.literal_translation: Age has caught up, the body doesn’t support anymore
entries.clinical_meaning: General fatigue, age-related decline, or frailty.
entries.cultural_context: Used with resignation; blends physical and emotional exhaustion.
example_use_cases: Patient: उम्र हो गई है बेटा, शरीर साथ नहीं देता अब।
Meaning: Expression of age-related weakness and fatigue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘body doesn’t cooperate with age’; preserve empathy.

entries.expression_native: अब तो हड्डियाँ जवाब दे रही हैं
entries.expression_translit: ab to haddiyan jawab de rahi hain
entries.literal_translation: Now even the bones are giving up
entries.clinical_meaning: Osteoarthritis or generalized bone weakness.
entries.cultural_context: Common elderly expression of chronic pain with humor or complaint.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द हर जोड़ में है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो हड्डियाँ जवाब दे रही हैं, दवा भी काम नहीं करती।
Meaning: Age-related joint degeneration with mild humor.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bones are giving up’; retain gentle humor if context allows.

entries.expression_native: पूरा बदन टूटा जा रहा है
entries.expression_translit: poora badan toota ja raha hai
entries.literal_translation: The whole body is breaking apart
entries.clinical_meaning: Generalized body ache; often due to viral illness, age, or fatigue.
entries.cultural_context: Everyday way of describing total fatigue or malaise.
disambiguation_questions: आराम करने से राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: तीन दिन से पूरा बदन टूटा जा रहा है।
Meaning: Viral or fatigue-related full-body pain.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘whole body is aching’; preserve tone of tiredness.

entries.literal_translation: The tiredness just doesn’t go away
entries.clinical_meaning: Persistent fatigue; possible anemia, depression, or hypothyroid.
entries.cultural_context: Said with frustration; implies ongoing tiredness despite rest.
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो थकान उतरती ही नहीं, कुछ करने का मन नहीं।
Meaning: Persistent tiredness; screen for underlying cause.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘tiredness that doesn’t go away’.

entries.expression_native: जोड़ों में जंग लग गया है
entries.expression_translit: jodon mein jang lag gaya hai
entries.literal_translation: Rust has set into the joints
entries.clinical_meaning: Joint stiffness from arthritis or aging.
entries.cultural_context: Playful metaphor likening old joints to rusty hinges.
disambiguation_questions: क्या सुबह ज्यादा जकड़न होती है?
क्या गर्म सेक से राहत है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब जोड़ों में जंग लग गया है, जैसे पुरानी मशीन।
Meaning: Typical humorous remark about aging joints.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘joints feel rusted/stiff’; retain humor.

entries.expression_native: अब तो उठने-बैठने में भी डर लगता है
entries.expression_translit: ab to uthne-baithne mein bhi dar lagta hai
entries.literal_translation: Now I even fear sitting and standing
entries.clinical_meaning: Mobility limitation due to arthritis or frailty.
entries.cultural_context: Said by elders expressing loss of confidence in movement.
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो उठने-बैठने में भी डर लगता है, पैर जवाब दे रहे।
Meaning: Frailty and fear of falling in elderly.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘fear or difficulty while standing or sitting’; empathic tone.

entries.literal_translation: The shoulders can’t bear any weight
entries.clinical_meaning: Muscle weakness or shoulder arthritis.
entries.cultural_context: Expresses decline in strength with age.
disambiguation_questions: क्या गिरने का डर लगता है?
क्या रोजमर्रा के काम में दिक्कत है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो कंधे बोझ नहीं उठा पाते जैसे पहले।
Meaning: Muscle weakness due to aging.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘shoulders can’t bear weight anymore’.

entries.expression_native: नींद भी अब पहले जैसी नहीं आती
entries.expression_translit: neend bhi ab pehle jaisi nahi aati
entries.literal_translation: Even sleep isn’t the same anymore
entries.clinical_meaning: Age-related sleep changes, anxiety, or depression.
entries.cultural_context: A reflective complaint blending physical and emotional fatigue.
disambiguation_questions: रात में कितनी बार नींद खुलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: नींद भी अब पहले जैसी नहीं आती, हर दो घंटे में जाग जाता हूँ।
Meaning: Age-related insomnia or anxiety-related disturbance.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘sleep has become poor with age’.

entries.expression_native: बूढ़ा शरीर है, दर्द तो रहेगा
entries.expression_translit: boodha sharir hai, dard to rahega
entries.literal_translation: It’s an old body, pain will always be there
entries.clinical_meaning: Chronic musculoskeletal pain normalized as part of aging.
entries.cultural_context: Acceptance of chronic pain as part of old age.
synonyms_variants: अब दर्द जीवन का हिस्सा है
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द बढ़ता जा रहा है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बूढ़ा शरीर है बेटा, दर्द तो रहेगा ही।
Meaning: Philosophical acceptance of pain as natural aging.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘It’s an old body, pain is part of life’; maintain respectful tone.

entries.expression_native: अब तो दवा भी असर नहीं करती
entries.expression_translit: ab to dawa bhi asar nahi karti
entries.literal_translation: Now even the medicine doesn’t work
entries.clinical_meaning: Perceived resistance or tolerance to pain relief/medicine.
entries.cultural_context: Common phrase reflecting frustration with chronic illness.
synonyms_variants: दवा लेने से भी आराम नहीं
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो दवा भी असर नहीं करती, सब थक गया है।
Meaning: Suggests chronic, poorly controlled pain or fatigue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘even medicines don’t help now’; empathetic phrasing advised.

entries.clinical_meaning: Age-related memory loss or early cognitive decline.
entries.cultural_context: Commonly used by elders describing forgetfulness.
disambiguation_questions: क्या जरूरी बातें भूल जाते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो याददाश्त कमजोर हो गई है, नाम तक याद नहीं रहते।
Meaning: Typical expression of mild cognitive decline.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘memory has weakened’; handle sensitively.

entries.expression_native: अब कान भी ठीक से नहीं सुनते
entries.expression_translit: ab kaan bhi theek se nahi sunte
entries.literal_translation: Now even the ears don’t hear well
entries.clinical_meaning: Age-related hearing loss (presbycusis).
entries.cultural_context: Said matter-of-factly or humorously by elders.
disambiguation_questions: कब से सुनने में दिक्कत है?
क्या दोनों कानों में समान है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब कान भी ठीक से नहीं सुनते, सबकी आवाज़ गूँजती है।
Meaning: Age-related sensorineural hearing loss.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘hearing isn’t clear anymore’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Reduced vision due to cataract, aging, or diabetes.
entries.cultural_context: Often said casually as part of aging conversation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या धुंधलापन लगातार बढ़ रहा है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब आँखें धुंधला गई हैं, अख़बार के अक्षर नहीं दिखते।
Meaning: Typical age-related visual decline or cataract.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘vision has become blurry’; use gentle tone.

entries.clinical_meaning: Loss of appetite; may indicate aging, depression, or illness.
entries.cultural_context: Often said with sadness, reflecting fatigue or disinterest in food.
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो भूख भी नहीं लगती, सब फीका लगता है।
Meaning: Reduced appetite; may require emotional screening.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘I don’t feel hungry anymore’; handle empathetically.

entries.expression_native: अब तो चलना भी भारी लगता है
entries.expression_translit: ab to chalna bhi bhaari lagta hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Physical weakness, fatigue, or frailty.
entries.cultural_context: Used commonly to describe loss of stamina in old age.
disambiguation_questions: क्या चढ़ाई पर ज़्यादा दिक्कत होती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब तो चलना भी भारी लगता है, दो कदम में थक जाता हूँ।
Meaning: Age-related fatigue or cardiovascular decline.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘even walking feels tiring’.

entries.literal_translation: The mind doesn’t feel like doing anything now
entries.clinical_meaning: Apathy, mild depression, or emotional burnout.
entries.cultural_context: Common in lonely elders; may indicate loss of motivation or mood decline.
disambiguation_questions: क्या किसी चीज़ में दिलचस्पी नहीं रहती?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब मन कुछ नहीं करता, अकेलापन लगता है।
Meaning: Indicative of emotional loneliness or depression.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘don’t feel like doing anything’; preserve empathy.

entries.expression_native: अब पहले जैसी ताकत नहीं रही
entries.expression_translit: ab pehle jaisi taqat nahi rahi
entries.clinical_meaning: Muscle weakness, aging, or post-illness fatigue.
entries.cultural_context: Used to compare present weakness with youthful vigor.
disambiguation_questions: कब से कमजोरी महसूस हो रही है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब पहले जैसी ताकत नहीं रही, सीढ़ी भी चढ़ना मुश्किल।
Meaning: Normal age-related decline or chronic fatigue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘I don’t have the strength I used to’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Breathlessness; possible heart or lung condition.
entries.cultural_context: Common among elders with cardiac or COPD issues.
disambiguation_questions: क्या आराम करने पर सांस ठीक हो जाती है?
क्या सीने में दर्द होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: थोड़ा चलने पर सांस छोटी पड़ जाती है।
Meaning: Early sign of cardiac or respiratory limitation.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘shortness of breath’.

entries.expression_native: अब अकेलेपन में मन घबराता है
entries.expression_translit: ab akelapan mein man ghabrata hai
entries.literal_translation: Now the heart feels uneasy in loneliness
entries.clinical_meaning: Anxiety, loneliness, or mild panic in isolation.
entries.cultural_context: Emotional phrase expressing fear and sadness when alone.
disambiguation_questions: क्या यह हर दिन होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब अकेलेपन में मन घबराता है, नींद भी नहीं आती।
Meaning: Emotional distress from loneliness.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feel uneasy when alone’; preserve emotional tone.

entries.expression_native: अब जीने की इच्छा नहीं रहती
entries.expression_translit: ab jeene ki ichha nahi rahti
entries.literal_translation: Now there’s no will to live
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe depression or existential fatigue.
entries.cultural_context: Expression of despair; may mask suicidal ideation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या कभी खुद को नुकसान पहुँचाने का मन हुआ?
कितने समय से ऐसा महसूस हो रहा है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अब जीने की इच्छा नहीं रहती, सब खत्म सा लगता है।
Meaning: Possible depression or suicidal ideation; needs urgent attention.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘no longer wish to live’; use immediate escalation protocols.

entries.clinical_meaning: Low-grade fever or post-viral residual temperature.
entries.cultural_context: Commonly used phrase meaning slight but persistent fever.
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से हल्का बुखार चल रहा है।
Meaning: Mild or residual fever after viral infection.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘mild ongoing fever’.

entries.clinical_meaning: High temperature, possibly due to infection or malaria.
entries.cultural_context: Describes peak fever episode, sometimes with chills or shivering.
example_use_cases: Patient: कल तेज़ बुखार चढ़ा था, शरीर तप गया था।
Meaning: High fever episode, possibly infectious.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘had a high fever’.

entries.expression_native: बुखार उतर गया लेकिन कमजोरी है
entries.expression_translit: bukhar utar gaya lekin kamzori hai
entries.literal_translation: The fever has gone down but weakness remains
entries.clinical_meaning: Post-fever fatigue; common after viral infections.
entries.cultural_context: Frequently used phrase after recovery; implies incomplete energy restoration.
disambiguation_questions: खाने-पीने में मन लग रहा है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार उतर गया लेकिन अभी भी कमजोरी है।
Meaning: Post-viral weakness common in recovery phase.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘weakness persists after fever’.

entries.literal_translation: There were shivers running through the body
entries.clinical_meaning: Chills and rigors; fever-related symptom, often in malaria.
entries.cultural_context: Used in North India for severe fever episodes.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पसीना आता है बाद में?
क्या रोज़ एक ही समय पर होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार के साथ कांपनी छूट रही थी।
Meaning: Classic description of fever with chills and rigors.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘had chills with fever’.

entries.literal_translation: The body is burning with heat
entries.clinical_meaning: High body temperature; fever with burning sensation.
entries.cultural_context: Widely used metaphor in India for high fever.
disambiguation_questions: क्या शरीर में जलन भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: शरीर तप रहा है, बुखार बहुत तेज़ है।
Meaning: Indicates high-grade fever.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘body burning with fever’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Fever broke after perspiration (defervescence).
entries.cultural_context: Common traditional sign that fever is subsiding.
synonyms_variants: पसीने के बाद ताप उतर गया
disambiguation_questions: क्या खाना खा पा रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: पसीना निकलने पर राहत मिली, ताप उतर गया।
Meaning: Indicates natural fever recovery.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘felt better after sweating’.

entries.literal_translation: The fever keeps coming again and again
entries.clinical_meaning: Recurrent fever; could indicate malaria, typhoid, or infection.
entries.cultural_context: Used widely when fever reappears after temporary relief.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन से बार-बार आ रहा है?
क्या ताप हर रोज़ एक समय पर आता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार बार-बार आता है, तीन दिन ठीक रहता है फिर लौट आता है।
Meaning: Suggests cyclic infection or relapse.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘recurrent fever’.

entries.expression_native: गला बैठ गया और बुखार भी है
entries.expression_translit: gala baith gaya aur bukhar bhi hai
entries.literal_translation: Throat has gone hoarse and fever is there too
entries.clinical_meaning: Upper respiratory infection; likely viral or flu.
entries.cultural_context: Common in seasonal changes; conveys throat inflammation with fever.
example_use_cases: Patient: गला बैठ गया और बुखार भी है, बोलना मुश्किल है।
Meaning: Viral pharyngitis or throat infection.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘sore throat with fever’.

entries.expression_native: बुखार में शरीर टूट रहा है
entries.expression_translit: bukhar mein sharir toot raha hai
entries.literal_translation: The body is breaking during fever
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe body ache associated with fever.
entries.cultural_context: Very common Indian way to describe viral fever body ache.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द पूरे शरीर में है?
क्या आराम करने से राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार में शरीर टूट रहा है, उठने का मन नहीं करता।
Meaning: Classic description of body ache in viral fever.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘body aching badly during fever’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Headache or heaviness due to fever, cold, or sinus.
entries.cultural_context: Everyday Indian idiom for feverish or congested feeling.
disambiguation_questions: क्या आंखों के पास भी दर्द है?
example_use_cases: Patient: सिर भारी लग रहा है और हल्का बुखार है।
Meaning: Common fever-related head heaviness.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling of heaviness in head’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Fever attributed to heat exhaustion, dehydration, or viral infection.
entries.cultural_context: Common summer expression for fever due to heat exposure or spicy food.
disambiguation_questions: क्या धूप में ज्यादा समय रहे?
example_use_cases: Patient: धूप में घूमने से गर्मी का बुखार हो गया।
Meaning: Heat-induced fever or dehydration-related fatigue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘heat-related fever’; clarify environmental cause.

entries.clinical_meaning: Fever with chills; often used to describe catching a cold or flu.
entries.cultural_context: Frequently used interchangeably for viral fever or cold.
disambiguation_questions: क्या नाक बंद है या खांसी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: कल रात ठंडी लग गई, सुबह से बुखार है।
Meaning: Common cold or flu with mild fever.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘caught a cold’; clarify fever presence.

entries.expression_native: डेंगू जैसा बुखार लग रहा है
entries.expression_translit: dengue jaisa bukhar lag raha hai
entries.clinical_meaning: High fever with body ache and fatigue; dengue suspected.
entries.cultural_context: Lay suspicion of dengue based on local prevalence and symptoms.
example_use_cases: Patient: ऐसा लग रहा है डेंगू जैसा बुखार है, शरीर दर्द कर रहा है।
Meaning: High fever with severe myalgia—possible dengue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feels like dengue fever’; note seriousness.

entries.clinical_meaning: Cyclical fever with chills and sweating; malaria suspicion.
entries.cultural_context: People self-diagnose malaria due to fever pattern or community spread.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर दूसरे दिन ताप आता है?
क्या कांपनी और पसीना आता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: मलेरिया जैसा बुखार लग रहा है, कांपनी आती है फिर पसीना।
Meaning: Classic description of malaria-like cyclic fever.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘fever pattern suggests malaria’.

entries.literal_translation: They said it’s a blood fever
entries.clinical_meaning: Lay term for typhoid, dengue, or any fever diagnosed via blood test.
entries.cultural_context: Frequently used after hearing test results; non-specific but alarming.
disambiguation_questions: क्या खून की रिपोर्ट देखी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: डॉक्टर ने कहा खून का बुखार है, आराम करने को कहा।
Meaning: Typhoid or infection identified in tests.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘blood infection or typhoid-like fever’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Confirmed or suspected typhoid fever.
entries.cultural_context: Widely known infection, often linked to food/water contamination.
example_use_cases: Patient: रिपोर्ट में टाइफाइड बताया है, सिर दर्द और कमजोरी है।
Meaning: Typhoid diagnosis based on test report.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘diagnosed typhoid fever’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Low-grade fever or fatigue-induced viral reaction.
entries.cultural_context: Common in India; people attribute fever to overwork or lack of rest.
disambiguation_questions: क्या आराम से बुखार उतर जाता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: ज़्यादा थकावट से बुखार आ गया, एक दिन आराम करने पर उतर गया।
Meaning: Mild transient fever from overexertion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘fever from exhaustion’.

entries.literal_translation: The mind feels heavy during fever
entries.clinical_meaning: Fever-associated headache or mental dullness.
entries.cultural_context: Describes brain fog or heaviness during fever.
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार में दिमाग भारी है, कुछ करने का मन नहीं।
Meaning: Brain fog or dullness during fever.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘head feels heavy during fever’.

entries.expression_native: बुखार उतरकर ठंड लग रही है
entries.expression_translit: bukhar utarkar thand lag rahi hai
entries.literal_translation: Feeling cold after the fever has gone down
entries.clinical_meaning: Post-fever chills or weakness.
entries.cultural_context: Used when temperature drops suddenly after high fever.
synonyms_variants: पसीने के बाद ठंड लग रही
disambiguation_questions: क्या ब्लड प्रेशर लो महसूस होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार उतरने के बाद ठंड लग रही है और हाथ-पैर ठंडे हैं।
Meaning: Chills or fatigue after fever subsides.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling cold after fever subsided’.

entries.expression_native: बुखार के बाद भूख नहीं लगती
entries.expression_translit: bukhar ke baad bhukh nahi lagti
entries.clinical_meaning: Post-illness anorexia or reduced appetite.
entries.cultural_context: Very common phrase in recovery phase; implies slow return to normalcy.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन से भूख कम है?
example_use_cases: Patient: बुखार के बाद भूख नहीं लगती, सब स्वाद चला गया है।
Meaning: Common loss of appetite after recovery.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘loss of appetite after fever’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Shortness of breath or dyspnea; possible asthma, COPD, or cardiac cause.
entries.cultural_context: Very common Indian expression for breathlessness, both physical and anxiety-related.
disambiguation_questions: क्या सीटी जैसी आवाज़ आती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: ज़रा चलने पर भी सांस फूल जाती है।
Meaning: Exertional breathlessness—possible asthma or heart issue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘shortness of breath’; clarify exertion and onset.

entries.clinical_meaning: Chest tightness or suffocation sensation; may indicate anxiety or respiratory congestion.
entries.cultural_context: Used for both physical congestion and emotional distress.
disambiguation_questions: क्या बंद जगह में ज़्यादा होता है?
क्या सांस लेने में दिक्कत है?
example_use_cases: Patient: रात को घुटन महसूस होती है, खिड़की खोलनी पड़ती है।
Meaning: May indicate anxiety or asthma-related tightness.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling suffocated’; note emotional tone.

entries.clinical_meaning: Chest tightness; can indicate bronchitis, asthma, or cardiac pain.
entries.cultural_context: Frequently used for both emotional stress and physical congestion.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द बाएं हाथ तक जाता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: छाती भारी लग रही है, सांस ठीक से नहीं आती।
Meaning: Possible chest congestion or cardiac pain.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘heaviness in chest’; differentiate cause.

entries.clinical_meaning: Intermittent breath obstruction; may indicate asthma, anxiety, or airway issue.
entries.cultural_context: Describes interrupted or difficult breathing in panic or illness.
disambiguation_questions: क्या सांस बंद होने जैसा लगता है?
क्या इनहेलर से राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: अचानक सांस अटकने लगी, लगा दम बंद हो जाएगा।
Meaning: Possible acute asthma or panic episode.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘breath feels stuck’; treat as urgent.

entries.expression_native: खांसी के साथ सांस फूलती है
entries.expression_translit: khansi ke saath saans phoolti hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Suggestive of bronchitis, asthma, or COPD.
entries.cultural_context: Common phrasing for chronic respiratory distress.
example_use_cases: Patient: खांसी के साथ सांस फूल जाती है, रात को ज्यादा दिक्कत।
Meaning: Classic asthma or bronchitis symptom.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘breathlessness with coughing’.

entries.literal_translation: It feels like the breath is choking
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe breathlessness or panic-induced suffocation.
entries.cultural_context: Can indicate both panic and physical distress; emotionally loaded phrase.
disambiguation_questions: क्या ये हर बार तनाव में होता है?
क्या बाहर खुली हवा में राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: भीड़ में दम घुटने लगता है, बाहर निकलना पड़ता है।
Meaning: Suggests panic or breathlessness in crowd.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feel suffocated or choked’; note emotional context.

entries.clinical_meaning: Wheezing or whistling sound during breathing; asthma or bronchospasm.
entries.cultural_context: Common in asthma or COPD; patient notices noisy breath.
disambiguation_questions: क्या इनहेलर से राहत मिलती है?
क्या सीटी जैसी आवाज़ हर सांस में है?
example_use_cases: Patient: सांस लेने में घरघराहट है, लगता है दम फूल जाएगा।
Meaning: Wheezing likely due to asthma attack.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘wheezing during breathing’.

entries.expression_native: सांस लेने में दर्द होता है
entries.expression_translit: saans lene mein dard hota hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Pleuritic chest pain or musculoskeletal pain.
entries.cultural_context: Used for pain on deep inspiration, often after cold or infection.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दर्द सांस लेने पर बढ़ता है?
क्या खांसी या बुखार भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: सांस लेने में दर्द होता है, खांसी भी है।
Meaning: Possible pleuritic inflammation or muscle strain.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘pain while breathing’.

entries.expression_native: सांस फूलकर आवाज़ आने लगती है
entries.expression_translit: saans phoolkar awaaz aane lagti hai
entries.literal_translation: When breath increases, a sound starts coming
entries.clinical_meaning: Wheezing during exertion; asthma or COPD.
entries.cultural_context: Describes breath sound during activity, recognized by laypeople.
synonyms_variants: दम फूलने पर सीटी बजती है
disambiguation_questions: क्या रात को भी सांस फूलती है?
क्या इनहेलर से आराम मिलता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: तेज़ चलने पर सांस फूलकर आवाज़ आने लगती है।
Meaning: Typical asthma complaint in Indian patients.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘wheezing on exertion’.

entries.expression_native: रात में सांस रुकने जैसा लगता है
entries.expression_translit: raat mein saans rukne jaisa lagta hai
entries.literal_translation: Feels like breath stops at night
entries.clinical_meaning: Possible sleep apnea, heart failure, or anxiety-related choking sensation.
entries.cultural_context: Used by elders describing nocturnal breath interruption.
disambiguation_questions: क्या रात में बार-बार उठते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: रात में सांस रुकने जैसा लगता है, अचानक जाग जाता हूँ।
Meaning: Suggestive of sleep apnea or cardiac failure.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feels like breath stops at night’; urgent screening advised.

entries.expression_native: पेट में जलन हो रही है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein jalan ho rahi hai
entries.literal_translation: There is burning in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Gastric acidity or acid reflux.
entries.cultural_context: Common household description for heartburn or gastritis.
synonyms_variants: सीने तक जलन आ रही है
disambiguation_questions: क्या खाने के बाद बढ़ती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर बार खाने के बाद पेट में जलन हो जाती है।
Meaning: Classic sign of gastric acidity.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘burning sensation in stomach’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Acid reflux or dyspepsia.
entries.cultural_context: Common Indian sign of indigestion or acidity.
disambiguation_questions: क्या रात में ज़्यादा होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: खट्टी डकारें आ रही हैं, खाने का मन नहीं करता।
Meaning: Suggests reflux or acidity.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘sour burping’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Indigestion, slow digestion, or bloating.
entries.cultural_context: Very frequent Indian phrase post-meal discomfort.
example_use_cases: Patient: खाना खाने के बाद पेट भारी लग रहा है।
Meaning: Common post-meal fullness or indigestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling of heaviness in stomach’.

entries.expression_native: पेट में गुड़गुड़ हो रही है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein gurgur ho rahi hai
entries.literal_translation: The stomach is making gurgling sounds
entries.clinical_meaning: Gastrointestinal movement, gas, or mild infection.
entries.cultural_context: Playful but descriptive Indian phrase for bloating or mild upset stomach.
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट में गुड़गुड़ हो रही है, लगता है कुछ गलत खा लिया।
Meaning: Indicative of mild gas or indigestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘stomach rumbling or gurgling’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Loss of appetite or nausea.
entries.cultural_context: Often associated with fever, stress, or gastritis.
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन से भूख नहीं लग रही?
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से खाने का मन नहीं है।
Meaning: Common symptom post-fever or stress.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘loss of appetite’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Nausea, vomiting sensation.
entries.cultural_context: Frequent expression in Indian households for upset stomach or pregnancy-related nausea.
disambiguation_questions: क्या खाना देखकर मितली होती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: कुछ भी खाती हूँ तो मितली आने लगती है।
Meaning: Typical nausea description.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling nauseous’.

entries.literal_translation: The stomach is not getting cleared
entries.clinical_meaning: Constipation or incomplete bowel evacuation.
entries.cultural_context: Daily concern in Indian families, linked to diet and wellness.
disambiguation_questions: क्या गैस या दर्द भी होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: तीन दिन से पेट साफ़ नहीं हो रहा, कब्ज लग गई है।
Meaning: Constipation complaint, culturally sensitive and common.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘constipation or not passing stool fully’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Bloating, reflux, or anxiety described through lay idiom.
entries.cultural_context: Extremely common Indian phrase — can mean heartburn, bloating, or tension.
disambiguation_questions: क्या छाती में जलन भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: गैस चढ़ गई है, सीने में भारीपन लग रहा है।
Meaning: Lay idiom for acidity or bloating.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘gas and heaviness in chest’; explain medically as acidity.

entries.expression_native: पेट में मरोड़ उठ रहा है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein marod uth raha hai
entries.literal_translation: Cramps are rising in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Abdominal cramps due to infection, diarrhea, or food poisoning.
entries.cultural_context: Used vividly to describe painful cramps or stomach ache.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दस्त भी हो रहे हैं?
क्या खाना बाहर का खाया था?
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट में मरोड़ उठ रहा है, उल्टी-दस्त लग रहे हैं।
Meaning: Suggestive of food infection.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘stomach cramps or twisting pain’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Severe bloating or flatulence.
entries.cultural_context: Very common Indian way of describing abdominal distension.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पेट में दर्द भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: रात के खाने के बाद पेट फूल गया है।
Meaning: Common complaint of bloating after meals.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bloating or swollen stomach’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Diarrhea, commonly due to food infection or stomach upset.
entries.cultural_context: Most common Indian phrase for diarrhea; widely understood.
disambiguation_questions: दिन में कितनी बार हो रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: कल रात से दस्त लग गए हैं, कुछ रुक नहीं रहे।
Meaning: Classic acute diarrhea complaint.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘loose motions or diarrhea’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Non-specific stomach disturbance — could mean diarrhea, nausea, or discomfort.
entries.cultural_context: Very common umbrella phrase for any digestive issue.
disambiguation_questions: क्या कोई बाहर का खाना खाया था?
example_use_cases: Patient: कल से पेट खराब है, कुछ भी खाते ही भागना पड़ता है।
Meaning: Common lay complaint of stomach upset.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘upset stomach’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Food poisoning from spoiled food.
entries.cultural_context: Commonly used when people suspect food poisoning.
example_use_cases: Patient: शायद खाना खराब हो गया था, उल्टी-दस्त शुरू हो गए।
Meaning: Indicates food poisoning episode.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘food got spoiled / food poisoning’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Acute gastroenteritis or food poisoning.
entries.cultural_context: Describes simultaneous vomiting and diarrhea; urgent medical issue.
disambiguation_questions: क्या पानी पी पा रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से उल्टी-दस्त चल रहे हैं, बहुत कमजोरी हो गई है।
Meaning: Acute dehydration from gastroenteritis.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘vomiting and loose motions’.

entries.expression_native: पेट में मरोड़ और दस्त हैं
entries.expression_translit: pet mein marod aur dast hain
entries.literal_translation: There are cramps and loose motions
entries.clinical_meaning: Infective diarrhea with abdominal cramps.
entries.cultural_context: Painful and urgent condition; typical rural phrasing.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर खाने के बाद होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट में मरोड़ और दस्त हैं, कुछ भी खा नहीं पा रहा।
Meaning: Classic infective diarrhea description.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘cramps with loose stools’.

entries.expression_native: पानी जैसे दस्त हो रहे हैं
entries.expression_translit: paani jaise dast ho rahe hain
entries.clinical_meaning: Severe diarrhea with dehydration risk.
entries.cultural_context: Common emergency description for severe loose stools.
example_use_cases: Patient: पानी जैसे दस्त हो रहे हैं, कमजोरी बढ़ रही है।
Meaning: Dehydrating diarrhea, urgent attention needed.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘watery loose motions’.

entries.expression_native: खाने के बाद भागना पड़ता है
entries.expression_translit: khane ke baad bhagna padta hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Post-meal diarrhea or IBS.
entries.cultural_context: Colloquial and humorous; used when digestion triggers loose motion.
disambiguation_questions: क्या कोई खास खाना खाने पर होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: खाना खाते ही भागना पड़ता है, कुछ रुकता नहीं।
Meaning: Indicative of food intolerance or chronic loose stools.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘have to rush to toilet after eating’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Mild diarrhea or unsettled stomach after bad food.
entries.cultural_context: Playful idiom for temporary stomach upset; no serious tone.
example_use_cases: Patient: कल चाट खाई थी, पेट हिल गया है।
Meaning: Slang for temporary loose motions after junk food.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘stomach upset from food’.

entries.expression_native: पानी की कमी लग रही है
entries.expression_translit: paani ki kami lag rahi hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Dehydration due to diarrhea or heat.
entries.cultural_context: Common Indian phrasing for dehydration or weakness.
disambiguation_questions: क्या बहुत चक्कर आ रहे हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: पानी की कमी लग रही है, होंठ सूख रहे हैं।
Meaning: Clear indicator of dehydration.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feeling dehydrated’.

entries.expression_native: हर चीज़ खाने से दस्त लग जाते हैं
entries.expression_translit: har cheez khane se dast lag jaate hain
entries.literal_translation: Loose motions start with anything eaten
entries.clinical_meaning: Chronic diarrhea, malabsorption, or infection.
entries.cultural_context: Used for persistent digestive weakness; often in elders.
synonyms_variants: कुछ भी खाओ, भागना पड़ता है
disambiguation_questions: कितने दिन से चल रहा है?
क्या हर चीज़ से होता है या कुछ खास?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर चीज़ खाने से दस्त लग जाते हैं, बहुत परेशानी है।
Meaning: Suggests chronic digestive sensitivity or IBS.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘loose motions after eating anything’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Traditional phrase for acidity or gastritis, linked to imbalance in ‘pitta dosha’.
entries.cultural_context: Ayurvedic framing still widely used to describe burning, sourness, and nausea.
example_use_cases: Patient: पित्त बढ़ गया है, कुछ भी खाओ तो जलन होती है।
Meaning: Common Ayurvedic phrasing for acidity and indigestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘acidity or bile-related stomach issue’.

entries.literal_translation: The food is not getting digested
entries.clinical_meaning: Indigestion, dyspepsia, or delayed gastric emptying.
entries.cultural_context: Used broadly for post-meal discomfort, bloating, or fullness.
disambiguation_questions: क्या गैस या डकार भी है?
example_use_cases: Patient: खाना हज़म नहीं हो रहा, लगता है अपच हो गया।
Meaning: Common Indian term for poor digestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘food is not digesting well’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Acid reflux or regurgitation.
entries.cultural_context: Typical phrasing for reflux symptoms in India.
synonyms_variants: खट्टी डकार के साथ खाना ऊपर आता है
disambiguation_questions: क्या रात में नींद टूटती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: खाना ऊपर चढ़ आता है, नींद में भी जलन होती है।
Meaning: Suggestive of acid reflux (GERD).
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘food coming back up (acid reflux)’.

entries.literal_translation: There is no taste in food
entries.clinical_meaning: Loss of taste, appetite, or early satiety — often in infections or depression.
entries.cultural_context: Used when appetite or taste is blunted.
example_use_cases: Patient: दो दिन से खाने में स्वाद नहीं आ रहा, सब फीका लगता है।
Meaning: Can indicate infection, COVID, or general fatigue.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘loss of taste or appetite’.

entries.expression_native: पेट में गैस घूम रही है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein gas ghoom rahi hai
entries.literal_translation: Gas is moving around in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Flatulence with migrating discomfort or bloating.
entries.cultural_context: A vivid idiom for trapped gas sensation.
disambiguation_questions: क्या राहत मिलती है गैस पास होने पर?
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट में गैस घूम रही है, चैन नहीं मिल रहा।
Meaning: Describes gassy discomfort or bloating.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘gas movement or bloating’.

entries.literal_translation: The burp is not coming out
entries.clinical_meaning: Trapped gas or indigestion.
entries.cultural_context: A very familiar phrase implying gas discomfort.
disambiguation_questions: क्या डकार लेने पर राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: डकार नहीं निकल रही, पेट में भारीपन है।
Meaning: Suggests trapped gas or reflux.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘unable to burp / trapped gas’.

entries.expression_native: पेट में भारीपन और उबकाई आ रही है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein bhaaripan aur ubkai aa rahi hai
entries.literal_translation: Heaviness and nausea in the stomach
entries.clinical_meaning: Indigestion, gastritis, or food poisoning.
entries.cultural_context: Common in cases of mild infection or overeating.
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट में भारीपन और उबकाई आ रही है, कुछ भी खाने का मन नहीं।
Meaning: Suggests mild gastritis or food infection.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘heaviness and nausea’.

entries.expression_native: खाने के बाद नींद सी आती है
entries.expression_translit: khane ke baad neend si aati hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Postprandial fatigue, heavy meal effect, or sugar dysregulation.
entries.cultural_context: Commonly mentioned when digestion is sluggish.
disambiguation_questions: हर बार खाने के बाद ऐसा होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर बार खाने के बाद नींद आ जाती है।
Meaning: Common complaint of sluggish digestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘feel sleepy after meals’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Lower abdominal heaviness or cramps; may relate to bowel, urinary, or menstrual issues.
entries.cultural_context: Used often by women to describe pelvic or abdominal heaviness.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दस्त या पेशाब में दिक्कत है?
क्या मासिक धर्म से पहले है?
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट नीचे खिंच रहा है, दर्द जैसा लग रहा है।
Meaning: Overlap of digestive and reproductive discomfort.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘lower abdominal pulling sensation’.

entries.expression_native: भूख लगते ही जलन शुरू हो जाती है
entries.expression_translit: bhukh lagte hi jalan shuru ho jaati hai
entries.literal_translation: As soon as hunger starts, burning begins
entries.clinical_meaning: Duodenal ulcer or acid-related gastritis.
entries.cultural_context: Indicative of hunger-pain pattern; common in chronic gastritis.
disambiguation_questions: क्या खाने से राहत मिलती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: भूख लगते ही पेट में जलन शुरू हो जाती है, खाना खाकर आराम मिलता है।
Meaning: Typical ulcer-related burning pattern.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘burning when hungry’ — likely ulcer symptom.

entries.literal_translation: There is a problem of constipation
entries.clinical_meaning: Chronic constipation or hard stools.
entries.cultural_context: Very common in older adults; seen as a key health indicator in Indian households.
disambiguation_questions: क्या दवा या हर्बल चूर्ण लेते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: कई दिनों से कब्ज की दिक्कत है, सुबह ठीक से साफ़ नहीं होता।
Meaning: Common constipation complaint.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘problem of constipation’.

entries.literal_translation: The stomach doesn’t get fully cleared
entries.clinical_meaning: Incomplete evacuation, IBS, or constipation.
entries.cultural_context: Reflects the Indian obsession with ‘pet safai’ (clean stomach).
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर रोज़ मल आता है?
क्या पानी या फाइबर कम लेते हैं?
example_use_cases: Patient: पेट साफ़ नहीं होता पूरा, बार-बार जाने का मन होता है।
Meaning: Typical IBS/constipation symptom.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘incomplete bowel clearance’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Constipation with hard stools or dehydration.
entries.cultural_context: Common lay term for straining during bowel movement.
example_use_cases: Patient: मल बहुत सख्त निकलता है, जोर लगाना पड़ता है।
Meaning: Constipation due to dehydration or poor diet.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘hard stool or constipation’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Hemorrhoids with pain, bleeding, or swelling.
entries.cultural_context: Culturally sensitive but openly discussed among older adults.
example_use_cases: Patient: बवासीर की तकलीफ़ है, बैठने में दर्द होता है।
Meaning: Typical hemorrhoid complaint.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘problem of piles or hemorrhoids’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Ayurvedic-style idiom for indigestion or pitta aggravation; not literal liver disease.
entries.cultural_context: Folk medicine term indicating internal heat or excess acidity.
example_use_cases: Patient: डॉक्टर, लीवर गर्म हो गया है, मुँह कड़वा लग रहा है।
Meaning: Lay phrasing for internal heat or mild indigestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘internal heat or acidity’. Avoid literal liver disease unless evidence.

entries.clinical_meaning: Bitter taste due to liver issues, acidity, or infection.
entries.cultural_context: Common complaint for digestive sluggishness or bile imbalance.
example_use_cases: Patient: सुबह उठते ही मुँह कड़वा लगता है।
Meaning: Often linked with acidity or bile imbalance.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘bitter taste in mouth’.

entries.expression_native: खाने के बाद पेट निकल आता है
entries.expression_translit: khane ke baad pet nikal aata hai
entries.literal_translation: The stomach comes out after eating
entries.clinical_meaning: Post-meal bloating or distension.
entries.cultural_context: Playful yet descriptive; common phrasing for visible bloating.
disambiguation_questions: क्या डकार से राहत मिलती है?
क्या पेट दर्द भी होता है?
example_use_cases: Patient: थोड़ा भी खा लूं तो पेट निकल आता है।
Meaning: Common bloating description.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘stomach bloats after eating’.

entries.expression_native: हर समय गैस बनती रहती है
entries.expression_translit: har samay gas banti rehti hai
entries.literal_translation: Gas keeps forming all the time
entries.clinical_meaning: Chronic bloating or dyspepsia, often due to diet or stress.
entries.cultural_context: Common middle-aged complaint; attributed to irregular meals.
disambiguation_questions: क्या खाने के बाद बढ़ती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: हर समय गैस बनती रहती है, कुछ भी खा लो।
Meaning: Chronic flatulence or indigestion.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘constant bloating or gas formation’.

entries.clinical_meaning: Functional dyspepsia or indigestion.
entries.cultural_context: Highly common phrase in Indian homes for slow digestion.
disambiguation_questions: क्या हर बार खाना खाने पर होता है?
क्या गैस या जलन भी होती है?
example_use_cases: Patient: खाना पचता नहीं, पेट में भारीपन रहता है।
Meaning: Chronic indigestion pattern.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘food doesn’t digest properly’.

entries.expression_native: पेट में ठंड लग गई है
entries.expression_translit: pet mein thand lag gayi hai
entries.clinical_meaning: Cultural belief indicating diarrhea or chills due to cold exposure or food.
entries.cultural_context: Commonly used by elders for loose stools after cold water or weather.
example_use_cases: Patient: ठंडा पानी पी लिया था, पेट में ठंड लग गई है।
Meaning: Common idiom for diarrhea from cold intake.
entries.translation_guidelines: Translate as ‘caught a stomach chill / mild diarrhea’.
